intro: Phacelia curvipes var. eucurvipes, commonly known as the wavy phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, wavy-edged leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its rapid growth and attractive appearance make it a popular choice for wildflower gardens and ecological restoration projects.
